settings.heading: Finance Your Purchase with Sleep First

settings.content1: You won’t be charged a yearly fee, so you can spend your cash on the stuff that counts.
settings.content2: Follow the steps during checkout to apply for your Sleep First Financing Card.
settings.content3: Built-in protection features ensure that you won't be held responsible for unauthorized transactions.

settings.heading: Three ways to apply for your sleep First financing card
settings.content: If you already have one, select “Pay By Sleep First Financing Card” on a product or In your cart
settings.legal_text: *The Wells Fargo credit card is issued with approved credit by Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. For newly opened accounts, the APR for Purchases is 28.99%. If you are charged interest in any billing cycle, the minimum interest charge will be $1.00. This information is accurate as of 12/01/2023 and is subject to change. For current information, call us at 1-800-431-5921.

settings.heading: Start Shopping!
settings.content:
Add products to your online shopping cart, and apply for financing at checkout.

Visit any product page to view a payment calculator, and prequalify with just a few easy clicks.

settings.question: What is the benefit of a Sleep First Financing Card?
settings.answer:
The Sleep First Financing Card offers a convenient and flexible way to finance your mattress purchase. Benefits include:

  • Spread Payments Over Time: This card allows you to pay for your mattress in smaller, manageable installments, making it easier to budget for a high-quality mattress without the burden of a large, one-time payment.
  • Easy Management: You can easily track and manage your payments online, giving you better control over your finances.
  • Enhanced Purchasing Power: The card increases your purchasing power, enabling you to choose the mattress that best suits your needs without being limited by upfront cost.

settings.question: What is the difference between the pre-qualification process and the application process?
settings.answer:
• Pre-Qualification Process: This is a quick, initial step to gauge your eligibility for the financing card without impacting your credit score. It involves a soft credit check, which gives an indication of your likelihood of approval. However, pre-qualification does not guarantee approval, as it is based on limited information.
  • Application Process: This is the formal process of applying for the financing card. It involves a thorough review of your credit history and financial situation, which includes a hard credit inquiry that may impact your credit score. This process leads to a decision on whether you're approved for the card and determines your credit limit and terms.

settings.question: Can I apply directly without going through the pre-qualification process?
settings.answer: Yes, you can apply directly for the Sleep First Financing Card without going through the pre-qualification process. However, keep in mind that directly applying will involve a hard credit inquiry, which may affect your credit score. The pre-qualification process is a helpful step to understand your chances of approval with a softer impact on your credit.

settings.question: If I apply and am approved, am I guaranteed the same credit limit I was pre-qualified for?
settings.answer: No, being pre-qualified does not guarantee that you will receive the same credit limit upon approval. The pre-qualification process provides an estimate based on a preliminary review of your financial information. The actual credit limit is determined after a more comprehensive review of your financial situation during the application process.

settings.question: I didn’t get pre-qualified. Should I still apply for financing?
settings.answer: If you did not get pre-qualified, it suggests that your financial profile may not meet the current criteria for the financing card. However, you can still choose to apply, keeping in mind that the application process involves a more detailed review of your financial situation and a hard credit inquiry. If your circumstances have changed or you believe there were inaccuracies in your pre-qualification assessment, applying may still be worthwhile. Alternatively, consider other financing options or reach out to our customer service for guidance.
